alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 2:36PM CDT until August 27 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Mississippi, including the following county, Lauderdale. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 235 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lauderdale, Meridian, Meridian Station, Marion, Zero, Nellieburg, Toomsuba, Daleville, Suqualena, Savoy, Increase, Alamucha, Meehan, Kewanee and Martin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
